channel.title: Comments on: Tips For Using Backbone.js Routers With HTML5 PushState

item.title: By: Derick Bailey
item.dc:creator: Derick Bailey
item.description: FYI - ignore everything i've struck through in this post. turns out it's garbage and as Nieve points out in the comments, doesn't work the way I though it did.
item.content:encoded: FYI – ignore everything i’ve struck through in this post. turns out it’s garbage and as Nieve points out in the comments, doesn’t work the way I though it did.

item.title: By: Derick Bailey
item.dc:creator: Derick Bailey
item.description:
sadly, no... i didn't intend that behavior, and now i see how mistaken i was when i wrote that code and this article. :-/
I've posted a note at the top of this article saying I was wrong... but i need to do something more than that, i think.
item.content:encoded:
sadly, no… i didn’t intend that behavior, and now i see how mistaken i was when i wrote that code and this article. :-/

I’ve posted a note at the top of this article saying I was wrong… but i need to do something more than that, i think.

item.title: By: Nieve
item.dc:creator: Nieve
item.description: I probably got it all wrong, but when I go to your BackboneTraining.net site and I navigate through it, hitting back/forward doesn't do anything- the view stays the same. I tried Firefox 7, Opera, the lastest chrome and nada. Is this the expected behaviour?
item.content:encoded: I probably got it all wrong, but when I go to your BackboneTraining.net site and I navigate through it, hitting back/forward doesn’t do anything- the view stays the same. I tried Firefox 7, Opera, the lastest chrome and nada. Is this the expected behaviour?

item.title: By: Anonymous
item.dc:creator: Anonymous
item.description: I just thought about dropping my router after this post, however I'm actually making use of their only benefit: extracting parameters from URLs, which is quite a nice but probably its only feature :D
item.content:encoded: I just thought about dropping my router after this post, however I’m actually making use of their only benefit: extracting parameters from URLs, which is quite a nice but probably its only feature :D
